name: 吳和庭
objective: The course of probability considers events that may or may not occur. It provides mathematical and logical models to describe random phenomena occurred in natural science, engineering, and social behaviors. This course is an important branch of applied mathematics. The basic theory and numerous applications will be covered.
schedule:
Week  1. Introduction to Probability; Counting Principle
Week  2. Permutations and Combinations
Week  3. Sample Spaces, Event and Axioms of Probability
Week  4. Some Propositions; Equally Likely Fundamental Events
Week  5. Conditional Probability; Bayes Formula
Week  6. Independent Events; Sequential Events
Week  7. Midterm 1; Random Variables
Week  8. Discrete random Variable,  CDF, PMF
Week  9. Expectation, Variance, and Well Known Discrete Random Variables.
Week 10. Continuous Random Variable and PDF
Week 11. Well Known Continuous random Variables
Week 12. Function of a Random Variable; Midterm 2
Week 13. Two and Multi Dimensional Random Variables
Week 14. (Expectations of) Sums of Random Variables
Week 15. Correlation and Covariance; Conditional Expectation
Week 16. Inequality, the Law of Large Numbers and Limit Theorems
Week 17. Selected Topics (Poisson Process, Markov Chain etc)
Week 18. Final Exam
